messages.content: Honestly, I like the *idea* of this card. It's slight damage, making you not have to worry about Nob getting angery. It's soulburn, so playing it at any time will compound the soulburn you already had on the enemy by the time you played the card. And then it's Vulnerable, which is neat for the attacks you do play. Granted, I probably play way more attacks than is optimal on Hexaghost.
i either find worthy sacrifice/haunted hand/rewind and go turbo turn 2 infinite or find 3rd seal and get to neow with like 50 good cards
I mean, "optimal" doesn't exist. Play what feels comfortable.
everything else is playing on instinct
rewind was changed, pretty sure it doesn't go infinite
<rewind>

A somewhat recently changed card for hexaghost, and one that I really like right now. Part of why is scarcity, this is your only access to vulnerable on the whole class. Another part is the soulburn application, and it being a cheap attack. It's really important to apply soulburn as early as you can in fights with hexaghost so that you aren't waiting until turn 5 or 6 for the damage to actually happen, so having a damage common apply it cheaply is a nice way to access that damage faster. As a cheap attack, it also does a good job of triggering your searing ghostflames, which apply even more soulburn. Very good at removing artifact charges as well, removing two by itself, and possibly three if played to activate the searing ghostflame. The upgrade is fantastic, getting a full turn of additional vulnerable makes heat metal into a very efficient card that provides some temporary damage scaling.

How good is vulnerable for hexaghost? Considering that you have soulburn, crushing ghostflame, and the inferno ghostflame as damage sources, none of which are affected by vulnerable, it can vary a lot. If your deck is heavily focusing on soulburn, or has a lot of intensity and can quickly get around the circle to activate the inferno ghostflame, vulnerable won't help very much. But if you deck has multiple sword of nights, damaging afterlife cards, phantom fireballs, cheap attacks, or several of the ninja relics, that vulnerable can become really useful. With all the soulburn stuff on hexaghost (especially from your searing ghostflames, and the first part of heat metal), you can usually land the vulnerable even on enemies with artifact charges, which makes it a fairly reliable source of damage scaling, especially if you can upgrade it. 

This will mostly shine in act 1, where you are still playing your strikes as well as taking front-loaded damage cards and appreciate the vulnerable in fights that are mostly fast races. Quite good into all 3 act 1 elites, especially lagavulin.

Still pretty solid in act 2, with lots of short and medium length fights, but starts to fall off more noticeably in acts 3/4. Can sometimes be a useful tool against neow specifically to deal enough damage to get through god of life in a timely fashion. That vulnerable scaling can also be important into fights like ironclad 1, ironclad 3, or defect 2 to end them more quickly. Being able to remove defect 2's artifact charge, still apply the vulnerable, and allow you to possibly apply further soulburn for 1 energy is a really nice upside.
